channel.title: [C++] Graphics Libraries
channel.description:
I might move on to 2D graphics in C++ and I'm not sure what API's I should use. This URL http://cplusplus.com/articles/1w6AC542/ gives me quite a few options.
Simple Fast Multi-Media Library (SFML): http://www.sfml-dev.org/ Simple DirectMedia Layer (SDL): http://www.libsdl.org/ Allegro: http://www.allegro.cc/ OpenGL (GFX only, however, there are wrapper libs like AllegroGL): http://www.opengl.org/ DirectX (Windows only): http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/directx/ Irrlicht (3d lib): http://irrlicht.sourceforge.net/
Any you recommend for a beginner at C++? Anything that's simple. Doesn't need to be complex or comprehensive.

item.title: [C++] Graphics Libraries
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

I personally favor SDL, but that is because I’ve never needed a full on 3D engine, I could get by with a rudimentary one I wrote. SDL, Allegro, and SFML will give you access to most forms of input and output, and have straightforward methods for handling sprites, so the choice is yours.
